intro: Notopleura longipedunculoides, commonly known as the long-peduncled notopleura, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
